item.title: Database Design: Sorting by Concepts on Nullable Fields
item.description: In a recent project, we had this requirement to sort a list of items by a concept that is absent in the database schema, but can be derived from other fields. To make it easy to understand, let’s build an example, simple enough to isolate the topic of interest. Let’s say we have a list of locations, stored in a database table as follows: Locations (location_id (primary key), province_id (NULL), city_id (NOT NULL)) And say, we want to present a list of locations sorted by “address”.
